fields.description:
*Problem:* When JIRA starts the automated XML backup, the server seems to stop creating issue from emails. The system also seems to never come back to normal unless JIRA server is restarted.

*Workaround:* Switch to db dump for automated backups.

*Relevant KB article:* [This one|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Stops+Creating+Issues+from+Emails]
fields.summary: JIRA stops creating issues from emails when automated XML backup starts

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# create new project
# create new custom field type Radio Button
# create new Field Configuration
# in the new Field Configuration, configure Radio Button as Required
# associate the new Field Configuration with a new Field Configuration Scheme
# create a new issue using the new Field Configuration, the error appear as shown in the screenshot RadioButtonProblem.png


Extra notes:
* this problem is not reproducible in JIRA 5.1.2 standalone.
* For issue types that does not use the Field Configuration that has the Radio Button as required, there is no problem as per shown in the screenshot NotRequiredRadioButton.png
fields.summary: Required Radio Button Has Character "d" Overlap With The Required Icon
Add support for Chrome Frame in IE

fields.description:
When sharing an issue with other users via e-mail, the JIRA refuses to accept any e-mail address which contains a '#' (pound sign) in the username/local part of the address. This prevents sharing issues with users who have a '#' character in their e-mail address (which is perfectly acceptable as per RFC 3696, et al.). 

From the standard [RFC3696|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3696]:
{quote}Without quotes, local-parts may consist of any combination of
   alphabetic characters, digits, or any of the special characters

      ! # $ % & ' * + - / = ?  ^ _ ` . \{ | } ~
{quote}

Email addresses containing those characters get rejected as invalid when they should not.

*Workaround*

Create a JIRA user with the email address set to the invalid email address, and then you can type the email address into the Share Issue field without problems.
fields.summary: Sharing Does Not Accept Email Addresses with valid special characters on it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29530].
  {panel}

Admins are able to delete active workflow schemes, which would cause the associated workflows to appear inactive, opening the possibility to having an active workflow being deleted, resulting in issues that have no transitions or transitions that are incorrect. You will probably see in the logs:

* Some warnings like:
{noformat}
2012-08-29 14:30:08,476 http-bio-8090-exec-10 ERROR admin 869x18070x1 k49von 172.20.9.76 /browse/MKY-2 [atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl] State of issue [MKY-2] has an action [id=11] which cannot be found in the workflow descriptor
2012-08-29 14:30:08,476 http-bio-8090-exec-10 ERROR admin 869x18070x1 k49von 172.20.9.76 /browse/MKY-2 [atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl] State of issue [MKY-2] has an action [id=21] which cannot be found in the workflow descriptor
2012-08-29 14:30:08,476 http-bio-8090-exec-10 ERROR admin 869x18070x1 k49von 172.20.9.76 /browse/MKY-2 [atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl] State of issue [MKY-2] has an action [id=41] which cannot be found in the workflow descriptor
2012-08-29 14:33:03,579 http-bio-8090-exec-17 ERROR admin 870x18295x1 k49von 172.20.9.76 /browse/MKY-2 [atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl] State of issue [MKY-2] has an action [id=11] which cannot be found in the workflow descriptor
2012-08-29 14:33:05,850 http-bio-8090-exec-17 ERROR admin 870x18295x1 k49von 172.20.9.76 /browse/MKY-2 [atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl] State of issue [MKY-2] has an action [id=21] which cannot be found in the workflow descriptor
2012-08-29 14:33:08,013 http-bio-8090-exec-17 ERROR admin 870x18295x1 k49von 172.20.9.76 /browse/MKY-2 [atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl] State of issue [MKY-2] has an action [id=41] which cannot be found in the workflow descriptor
{noformat}
* Exceptions like:
{noformat}
2012-08-29 14:44:07,202 http-bio-8090-exec-15 ERROR admin 883x463x1 x4ixsb 172.20.9.76 /browse/MKY-2 [opensymphony.workflow.basic.BasicWorkflow] Error checking available actions
com.opensymphony.workflow.FactoryException: Unknown workflow name
        at com.opensymphony.workflow.config.DefaultConfiguration.getWorkflow(DefaultConfiguration.java:92)
        at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.getAvailableActions(AbstractWorkflow.java:77)
        at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl.getAvailableActionIds(IssueWorkflowManagerImpl.java:140)
        at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl.getAvailableActions(IssueWorkflowManagerImpl.java:41)
        at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl.getSortedAvailableActions(IssueWorkflowManagerImpl.java:65)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.transitions.TransitionLinkFactory.getAvailableActions(TransitionLinkFactory.java:63)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.transitions.TransitionLinkFactory.getLinks(TransitionLinkFactory.java:52)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.webfragment.DefaultSimpleLinkManager.getLinks(DefaultSimpleLinkManager.java:190)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.webfragment.DefaultSimpleLinkManager.getLinksForSection(DefaultSimpleLinkManager.java:124)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.util.IssueOperationsBarUtil.getLinksForSection(IssueOperationsBarUtil.java:208)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.util.IssueOperationsBarUtil.getPromotedLinks(IssueOperationsBarUtil.java:105)  <+3> (NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
        at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:70)
        at webwork.util.InjectionUtils.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:56)
        at webwork.util.ValueStack.findValue(ValueStack.java:514)
        at webwork.util.ValueStack.findValue(ValueStack.java:213)
        at webwork.view.taglib.WebWorkBodyTagSupport.findValue(WebWorkBodyTagSupport.java:62)
        at webwork.view.taglib.BasicPropertyTag.doStartTag(BasicPropertyTag.java:54)
        at org.apache.jsp.includes.panels.issue.viewissue_002dopsbar_jsp._jspx_meth_ww_005fproperty_005f6(viewissue_002dopsbar_jsp.java:535)
{noformat}

You should be able to fix this by migrating that project onto a new workflow scheme. You cannot use the default workflow scheme.
fields.summary: Admins are able to delete active workflow schemes, potentially resulting in data corruption

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29528].
  {panel}

h3. Replication Steps

# Install [chrome frame|http://www.google.com/chromeframe/eula.html] into IE8.
# Browse to *Administration > Project > People*.

h3. Current Behaviour

As in the attached screenshot, the page does not render and only displays {{wait.gif}}.

h3. Expected Behaviour

The page loads successfully.

h3. Workarounds

* Disable the Chrome Frame plugin.
* Use another browser, such as Chrome or Firefox.

(!) Whilst this is not supported, as in our [Supported Platforms|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms], this case has been raised as the Chrome Frame is an excellent workaround for organisations who have to use IE.
fields.summary: When using Chrome Frame in IE8, Project > People does not load

fields.description:
As discussed in [JSP-136266|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-29521]:


* make a draft WF from your current live-workflow, e.g. "Simple Workflow",
* when "do you want to make a backup was asked, I accidently hit space key followed by the pound/enter key.
** This causes, there were TWO Workflows, one called "Simple Workflow" and another "Simple Workflow " (see the space key at the end.
* the second one was marked as "inactive" but marked as linked with the current live workflow scheme
* Then I entered the "backup" worflow and tried to rename it to "Simple Workflow - BU"
* This caused, the BACKUP was renamed but and WENT LIVE.
** i.e. The edited and last live-Workflow is no longer associated with the workflow scheme! 
* the "Simple Workflow" including the changes was now marked as inactive as like any other workflow backup
* Then I created a new Workflow Scheme, copied from current Live-Scheme and made use of the "Simple Workflow"
* Then I attached this new Scheme "Workflow Scheme v2" to a project
* All worked fine until ...
* restarting the server
* no issues of this project can't be opened anymore, just saying:
{noformat}Could not find workflow for issue 'PRJ-123'. This can be fixed by running the integrity checker{noformat}

Indeed, it can't be fixed by integrity checker!

The "Simple Workflow" seems to get lost on restart!

This issue was "fixed" by:
* fixing the WF Scheme : https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/FQjCDQ
* creating a copy of the "Simple Workflow - BU" called "Simple Workflow"
** This causes, any other relations in the systems are running again, and Workflow actions might be triggered.
** IF this step is skipped, no transaction buttons are shown, nevertheless the integrity check says "all fine"

-----

[~jtye] {quote}I tried reproducing this issue in my local instance (although I used JIRA 5.1), and I was able to reproduce it right until when you created a new workflow scheme which used the original workflow, and associated it with a certain project. Everything, from the creating of a workflow with a space behind, to the renaming of the backup workflow causing it to go live happened in my instance as well.

, I have not encountered the error where it says 'Could not find workflow for issue'. I am still trying to figure out what might have triggered it.{quote}
fields.summary: Making Workflow backups with a space behind will crash Workflowschemes and project associations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29503].
  {panel}

When users share filters or Dashboards with 'Everyone' the following message is displayed:
"Sharing with everyone will make this visible to users who are not logged in."

But this leads them to believe that only jira-users not logged will be able to view and not every person that manages to find the 'Manage Filters' or 'Manage Dashboards' link.

Also, on the 'Manage Filters' or 'Manage Dashboards' screen they are displayed as 'Shared with all users' which strengthens the belief that it is only shared with internal users.

It would be better to change this labels to 'Share with world' to enforce that everyone will have access to the filters.
fields.summary: Wording for sharing Filters and Dashboards with Everyone is misleading

!perm.png!

Could we enrich it a bit based on what the Project Administrator can and cannot do (e.g. _Administer Project - Please note that some actions in Workflows and Issue Types require a Global Administrator Permission_)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29498].
  {panel}

As a Jira administrator, I would like to select one of multiple renderers in field configurations at least for version system fields (and version custom fields). This would allow to use Fix versions in Greenhopper even if it is slightly customized, e.g.:
* to support single selection
* to extend the version number by additional information like 
** a build number when showing it on view screens
** version numbers from incomming and/or outgoing links (see attached image) 

Both Atlassian and customer should be able to provide renderer.

With the current approach, where renderer are not pluggable, customers have to use custom fields in many situations, which means Greenhopper cannot fully work.
fields.summary: Pluggable renderer at least for fix version system field needed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Report
When using the Internet Explorer 8.0.7600.16385 browser to navigate search results from Issue Navigator, a considerable slow performance can be observed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# To replicate, go to the Issues tab and perform a search. Size of search results doesn't matter.
# Click on the Key of one of the issues.
|
*Problem 1:* Takes 9 to 13 seconds for the view screen to finish loading so that functionality on the screen can be applied.
|
# Click on the Next issue button (top right of screen).
|
*Problem 2:* Takes 10 to 15 seconds for the next issue to finish loading (so that the Next Issue button is enabled again).

h3. Workaround
The usage of Internet Explorer 9.0.8112.16421 does not exhibit this problem.
fields.summary: Internet Explorer 8 (IE8) Performance when Using the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29493].
  {panel}

As per REST documentation in http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id123696

there is no API to update a project details, mainly the 'description', 'url' and 'name'. 

Those fields can be editing in a SOAP call, but as SOAP is being deprecated in favor of REST, it would be good to get this PUT call implemented. 

(I've also checked http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/5.2-m03/ and it doesn't seem to be there as well).

Equivalent SOAP call:
http://docs.atlassian.com/rpc-jira-plugin/4.4/com/atlassian/jira/rpc/soap/JiraSoapService.html#updateProject(java.lang.String, com.atlassian.jira.rpc.soap.beans.RemoteProject)

Thanks,
Johan.
fields.summary: Add Project update to REST API

fields.description:
To reproduce:

# Go to {{/secure/admin/AdvancedApplicationProperties.jspa}}
# Change a value (any value near the top) such that it creates a "Revert" button after submission
# Start editing the value for a different property anywhere *below* the first one
# Press enter while editing the 2nd value - the first Revert button is also pressed because it's the first submit button found on the form, causing the 1st value to be lost while the 2nd value is updated

(See screenshots)

I'm guessing Restful Table is set up to assume only one submit button will ever be present at a time (for the row being edited), so it doesn't override the default submit action of the form, which is to effectively click the first submit button found in the form.

I found this in 5.1 and tested in 5.1.3, but my guess is it was introduced by JRA-24974
fields.summary: Restful table in admin Advanced Settings page has double-submission bugs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29487].
  {panel}

We have this hardcoded in the scheduler configuration to run at midnight every day:

{code}
<trigger name="OptimizeIndexesTrigger" job="OptimizeIndexes" type="cron">
    <expression>0 0 0 * * ?</expression><!-- run at midnight -->
</trigger>
{code}

h3. TL;DR

That needs to go away.

h3. Detailed explanation for the curious

During normal operation, Lucene deletes documents by simply marking them as such but leaving them in the segment.  This is a performance trade-off because it makes the write much faster, but wastes disk space and would eventually slow down searches that have to skip over the deleted documents.

In older versions of Lucene, such as those used prior to JIRA 5.0, this is dealt with by explicitly optimizing the index, which rebuilds all of the segments without the deleted documents in them.  To make sure the indexes stay in reasonably good shape, we added the scheduled job shown above.

In JIRA 5.0, we adopted Lucene 3.2 and its new TieredMergePolicy that tries to distribute this work more reasonably over time by noticing when deleting a document puts the segment over some threshold (say 10% deleted documents) and optimizing that single segment immediately.  Since this happens automatically, there is much less reason to explicitly request a global optimization of the entire index, which for large customers in particular can be a very expensive operation and lead to request timeouts as write operations stall waiting up to 30 seconds for the index optimization to get out of the way if people happen to be doing work at midnight server time.

In some cases, we have even seen this lead to inconsistent state between the database and the Lucene indexes as the write requests for the index get dropped.  This was allegedly fixed in [JRA-14220|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-14220], but a recent support case indicates that it may not adequately address the problem.

In short, the optimize operation should be superfluous at this point, and the long delays it causes may be creating additional problems, so it should just go away.
fields.summary: Remove hardcoded OptimizeIndexTrigger from scheduler config
New mentions JS briefly shows "No matching results for" when a single char is typed after the @

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29485].
  {panel}

When I go here:
https://jira.atlassian.com/plugins/servlet/project-config/RNDR

and click on "Configure permission and default field values" at the bottom of the page (from remote issue copy plugin), it instead takes me to a screen for entering the API token for HipChat! 

!NaughtyHipChatPlugin_01_GotThis.png!

I then re-abled the HipChat plugin and the "Configure permission and default field values" works as expected, however, the hipchat conifguration action now takes me to the config page for "Configure permission and default field values"

!hip_chat_remote.png!

Marking critical because it isn't clear how consistent this is, and it could get in the way of something very important. It looks like a problem with JIRA rather than the plugins themselves.
fields.summary: Hipchat plugin is intercepting admin links for other modules

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29482].
  {panel}

If you have a multiselect custom field in one of the Issue Navigator columns, the order of the selected items is not properly showed.

In example, let's say that you have a multiselect field with 4 values (A, B, C and D). 
In one issue you selected the A and B option.
In the second issue, you selected the A, B and C option.

The column related to this custom field will show for the first issue this order: B, A.
And for the second issue, will show this: C, B, A.

It always shows the order from bottom to top, doesn't matter the order that you selected the options.

It will make more sense if this column show an alphabetical order of the selected values.
fields.summary: Change the default order of a Multiselect Custom Field column in the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29479].
  {panel}

As a software release engineer, I often need to search for our next release.  I am able to do so using: fixVersion = earliestUnreleasedVersion("PROJECT")

However, I also need to view tickets in the release after that (and after that).  It would be nice to be able to have a dashboard for this without having to modify filters.

Proposed solution: Implement math-based operators for fixVersion
Next release: fixVersion = earliestUnreleasedVersion("PROJECT")
Release after that: fixVersion = earliestUnreleasedVersion("PROJECT")+1
                    OR
                    fixVersion = earliestUnreleasedVersion("PROJECT", +1)
fields.summary: Add math-based operator functionality to fixVersion

fields.description:
Create a new custom field (in that case, a radio button) and associate it with two different projects, with a different default value to each one. When you are creating a new issue, the first screen shows the right default value of this radio button, but if you change the project, it doesn't change.

Steps to replicate:

- Create a new custom field and associate it with two different projects with a different default value for each one:

!custom_project2.png!

- Create a new issue. The first time will show the right default value of this custom field:

!custom_project3.png!

- Change the project. The custom field will not show the right default value (in my test, it doesn't show any value):

!custom_project1.png!
fields.summary: Custom Field default value doesn't change right between projects

We really appreciate you taking the time to provide us any feedback on the contents of the EAP.

Simply comment below for any comments you may have.

Cheers,

Bryan, Roy, Mairead, and Josh

JIRA Product Management

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29463].
  {panel}

While working with the Flash-based workflow editor, if you try to clone an existing transition and name the clone same as the original transition, the following exception ensues:

"com.exadel.flamingo.service.exception.ServiceInvokationException: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

Then, an empty transition box appears where the cloned transition should be, and if to click on it, the editor goes into infinite update state, which can only be interrupted by refreshing the whole page.
fields.summary: Flash workflow editor crashes if a cloned transition has the same name as the original one
Danger! Danger!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29460].
  {panel}

My apologies if this is fixed in 5.1 (I'll upgrade soon)....

In JIRA 5.0.5 and according the documentation, JIRA will not return a full JSON response when creating a issueLink  between 2 issues:
http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id120764
(POST /rest/api/2/issueLink).

Ideally, it would be nice to receive at least the link ID to store locally in case we need to re-use it (delete it) shortly after. That would save time instead of re-querying the JIRA issue(s) since I have all other link information except the ID after the post.

Cheers,
Johan.
fields.summary: Return JSON object with linkID on issueLink creation

fields.description:
Uploading an image to the JIRA logo and then choosing the DEFAULT option as the JIRA logo, still points to the uploaded image. Does not revert to default JIRA logo.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Login as admin and navigate to JIRA Look n Feel.
2. Edit the logo and upload an image as logo. Save settings.
3. Again edit the logo and this time choose the DEFAULT optoin.

Notice that the logo is still the uploaded image, however scaled.
fields.summary: Logo does not revert on choosing the default option in the Look & Feel
Support Postgres 9.1

fields.description: The link https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/2012/06/18/Bamboo+plan+for+running+bundled+plugin%27s+smoke+tests does not authenticate properly with oauth - see attached paste.  If you try to link https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/2012/06/18/Bamboo+plan+for+running+bundled+plugin's+smoke+tests then the authentication succeeds and the link is added.
fields.summary: Applinks causes an oauth failure with url escaped links

{code}2010-10-12 18:04:41,264 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-1 ERROR ServiceRunner    Service Provider Token Remover [atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner] An error occured while trying to run service 'Service Provider Token Remover'. null

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.oauth.serviceprovider.OfBizServiceProviderTokenStore.removeExpiredTokens(OfBizServiceProviderTokenStore.java:219)
	at com.atlassian.jira.oauth.serviceprovider.CachingServiceProviderTokenStore.removeExpiredTokens(CachingServiceProviderTokenStore.java:93)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)

	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invokeUnprivileged(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:56)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invoke(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:39)

	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.LocalBundleContextAdvice.invoke(LocalBundleContextAdvice.java:59)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)

	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at $Proxy545.removeExpiredTokens(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.oauth.serviceprovider.internal.DelegatingTokenStoreImpl.removeExpiredTokens(DelegatingTokenStoreImpl.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.oauth.serviceprovider.internal.ExpiredTokenRemover.execute(ExpiredTokenRemover.java:18)
	at com.atlassian.sal.jira.scheduling.JiraPluginSchedulerService.run(JiraPluginSchedulerService.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:48)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:195)

The current code does not check for null when retrieving the TTL value, so the question is what do we do in this case? Andreas, can you provide some insight as to how we should handle this case?
fields.summary: Stacktrace when trying to remove OAuth tokens which have a null value for the TTL column (Time To Live)

fields.description: Whenever we export to Excel via Issue Navigator, the resulting document is not seen as a valid Excel file (see attached image).  If I click 'Yes', it seems to open fine in Excel 2007.  Other colleagues are getting blank files.
fields.summary: Excel Export from Issue Navigator produces corrupt Excel files

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29452].
  {panel}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-Component

I have 2 projects, one with components and one with no components. If I write a query such as 

project in (HASCOMP, NOCOMP)

then I get all the issues I expect. If I write

project in (HASCOMP, NOCOMP) and component in ("Component A")

I only get issues from the HASCOMP project. The missing information is that you have to explicitly check for empty components to get the expected results. This can be done with:

project in (HASCOMP, NOCOMP) and (component in ("Component A") or component is EMPTY)

or with the undocumented value "Empty", as in:

project in (HASCOMP, NOCOMP) and component in ("Component A", Empty)
fields.summary: Document that Empty is a valid value for Component

fields.description:
When user install the Atlassian plugin "Admin Helper" and enable it, "Customize Colours and Dates" section can't be expand via _Administrations > Look and Feel > Edit Configuration_.

Besides, other navigator menus will not be clickable except 'Administration'. Please see the screenshot.

After disable the "Admin helper" plugin, everything will be work normally.
fields.summary: Unable to expand "Customize Colours and Dates" in Look and Feel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29450].
  {panel}

In the default workflow, the screens have help notes.
For example the resolve issue dialog:
!resolve issue.PNG!

It would be really nice, if it is possible to add an note to an custom screen...for informing the user about important things for using this screen.

It should be possible to define the type "error, info, .." and the message....or define the box with html. 
Maybe it could be done with transition properties....one for the type and one for the message.
fields.summary: Add notes to screens
Permissions on which fields can be edited depending on the status of the issue
Support IE 10

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29447].
  {panel}

In some organisations, as part of a set of security requirements, it is required for compliant applications, to disallow users to store there application password in their browser.

It would be perfect, if JIRA (and all other Atlassian applications) would allow to configure the autocomplete="off" attribute for username and password fields as well as turning of the "Remember me on this computer" function.

Here is how it might get implemented:
Add an boolean option called "Allow users to store there login and keeping logged in" in the Administration section under "General Configuration".
If set to On, JIRA should behave as today (default).
If set to Off, the login gadget as well as the dedicated login pages (including the Administrator login) should include the autocomplete="off" attribute for username and password fields. Additionally, the login gadget as well as the dedicated login page should not display the "Remember me on this computer" function.
fields.summary: As a JIRA System Administrator, I can instruct web browsers to not allow saving a user's password in the various login options, so that unauthorized users can not access the system.
A NullPointerException is thrown when the user navigates to the Issue Type Tab for a Project
jira service command does not support restart command

fields.description:
Hi all,

In a case where you have more gadgets than what can fit on the screen (Issue Navigator > Chart), there will be some gadgets that will not show up on the screen. Check the screenshot.


There should be a scroll bar on the pop up window to cover the complete list of gadgets.

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Gadget pop up window does not show scroll bar in case of overflow.

fields.description:
The 'getRemainingEstimateMinutes', 'getTimeSpentMinutes' and 'getOriginalEstimateMinutes' methods of the TimeTracking class do not return the expected values.

For instance, I have an issue with 67 hours logged, but the getTimeSpentMinutes is returning 45 hours. Note that if I sum up the minutes spent in the worklog class, I get 48 minutes, which is different again.
fields.summary: Time tracking values reported through the API are not correct

This does not appear to be browser-specific.

title search in Attach Google Docs window is un-clickable, not all doc types attach

fields.description:
As per [Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms] Firefox 3.6.24 is supported by JIRA. But while using Firefox, the Assignee Drop Down does not contain the users that are expected to see there. While using other browsers (with the same user logged in) this error does not occur.

* The {{Suggestions}} section for the user is not visible in Firefox while it is visible in {{Chrome}} for the same user
* Typing in the username also doesn't find the username in Firefox

The problem was locally replicated.
fields.summary: Assignee Drop Down Does Not List Users in Firefox 3.6.24
JIRA service does not start on Win7 (x64) if Java is not installed (Tomcat 7)

fields.description: This happens because the "all users" list is causes vertical scrollbars to appear on the page.

fields.description:
Embedding issue collector in JIRA itself (adding code via "announcement banner" section ;) ) and selecting an issue type which has more than the "summary" field needed (here: component) the drop-down selection isn't accessible neither via keyboard nor mouse!
That's boring!

Also reproducible without adding code to announcement banner via "preview" when issue collector has been saved once (see screenshot attached)

Same collector used in another environment works fine! (see second screenshot)

can be tested without login on https://ticket.mediaman.de
fields.summary: Issue Collector doesn't work in Jira with required selection fields
Issue Collector Badge has wrong font-color
As a user, I'd like to share dashboards with a specific user, not group or project role

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29428].
  {panel}

It's not unusual for me to do the following in JIRA:
# Comment on an issue.
# Close that same issue.
# Create a new issue.
# Attach several screen shots to the new issue.
# Edit the new issue to fix a typo
# Link it back to the just closed issue.

If I do all this I basically take over the activity stream for everyone else. What if instead of six discrete entries in the activity stream it queued them up for a few minutes and then only showed the last one? Something like:

_John Doe linked an issue (and five other changes)_

The "five other changes" would be a link that, when clicked, expanded the other changes and showed the activity stream in its full glory. This is somewhat analogous to what FishEye does for changesets.
fields.summary: Group Together Changes in Activity Stream so Busy User Doesn't Pollute It
Make Issue Excel View able to use an unsaved "Filter Columns order"
UI puts emphasis on Workflow actions over current status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29425].
  {panel}

When user want to share an issue, the share window is too small on IE browser. See this:
!IE.PNG|thumbnail!
Unlike the Firefox or Google Chrome which can allow user to drag the text box by click and drage on the button at down-right coner.
Firefox text box like:
!firefox.PNG|thumbnail!

Besides, in Firefox or Ghrome, when user drag the text box overload the window, the text will goes beyond. It will be looks like:
!text beyond.PNG|thumbnail!

Those actions are very inconvenience when user perform the share funtion.
fields.summary: Share issue Window is too small on IE

fields.description:
# Add a post function that will throw an exception when executed to a workflow transition (e.g. you can add a post function from a plugin that you subsequently disable or hack the workflow XML in the db to point to a class that does not exist). Make sure it is positioned after the "ReIndex Post Function".
# Assign that workflow to a project.
# Create an issue in that project.
# Move that issue through the transition such that we get an error on the server. 
# (BUG) Do a search for the issue. Note that the issue looks like it has been transitioned when viewed on the issue navigator.
# Look at the issue directly. Note that the issue *WAS NOT* transitioned.

In < 5.0.6 the indexed issue would not have changed. This was introduced as part of the fix for JRADEV-8810. If the transition is rolled-back then we need to make sure the issue is not indexed.
fields.summary: Failing a transition can leave JIRA and the index out of SYNC.

fields.description:
# Create a workflow with a transition that contains post-function from a plugin (e.g. HipChat)
# Assign that workflow to a project (through a scheme).
# Disable the plugin where that post function is coming from.
# Try to move an issue through a transition with the now disabled post-function. You end up with this:

!post_function.png!

We should give a better error message this is a hard problem to track down. Maybe we should give people the ability to configure whether or not failing a post function actually causes a transition from working.
fields.summary: Disabling a plugin used in a post function can stop a whole workflow from working

fields.description:
In IE8, if you use the noformat tag, and cut and paste a list/table containing multiple columns into the window, after you put the ending noformat tag in, and save the comment, you will end up with about 10 blank lines after the end of your last noformat tag. It does matter if the noformat tag is on the same line as the last line, or the following line.

IE8 also cuts off the right side of the data after 96 characters, and forces the use of a horizontal scroll bar at the bottom of the window. 

This behaviour does not appear in Firefox or Chrome. 

This bug refers to the original question at: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/78767/is-there-a-way-to-eliminate-all-the-extra-white-space-in-a-noformat-screen

NOTE: I had to remove the squiggly brackets before and after the noformat word because they messed up this description. 

{noformat}
This text block is here for quick reproduction of this issue.
{noformat}
fields.summary: The use of the {noformat} tag in Internet Explorer 8 results in extra blank lines after the ending {noformat} tag.

fields.description:
The issue collector popup box renders as expected in Firefox and Safari but is not displayed in a proper format when viewed in IE.

The 'email' form text-element is chopped off when viewing in IE 6/7/8/9(also shows scroll bars on the right and the bottom of the popup box), but appears fine in Firefox and Safari as shown in the screenshots below.
